key_mistakes.reason: This move weakens the d4 pawn and allows Black to gain a strong central pawn structure.
Fails to address the threat of ...e4 and leaves the bishop on b2 vulnerable.
This move recaptures with the wrong piece, allowing Black to maintain pressure.
Retreating the bishop loses control of the center and fails to create counterplay.
This move allows Black to create a passed pawn and opens up the position favorably for Black.
A passive move that fails to capitalize on the opportunity to retaliate with Qxe8+.

themes: Opening principles: Control the center and develop pieces effectively.
Pawn structure: Avoid creating weaknesses that can be exploited.
Counterplay: Look for active moves that challenge the opponent's setup.
recommendations: Focus on controlling the center and developing your pieces efficiently in the opening.
Avoid creating unnecessary pawn weaknesses that can be targeted by your opponent.
Look for opportunities to challenge your opponent's position with active moves.
